measured_by: free ranking task of probability statements (RANK condition)
justification: "In the RANK condition, the participants were asked to rank the statements according to their perceived probability." This free-ranking procedure was used to determine whether participants committed the conjunction fallacy.

measured_by: binary choice between a fallacious and non-fallacious ranking (CHOOSE condition)
justification: "In the CHOOSE condition, participants were presented with two rankings… Participants in the CHOOSE condition were asked to choose which ranking they agreed with." The choice outcome served to measure fallacy occurrence.

measured_by: binary choice between rankings presented by social robots (SOCIAL condition)
justification: "To study the influence of the presenter, we introduced the SOCIAL condition, in which a video of a social robot presenting the rank ordering came before the participants' choosing." The selections made after the robots’ presentation were used to assess conjunction fallacy rates.
